articles.headline: Obama Vows Fast Action in New Push for Gun Control
articles.snippet: Leading House Republicans restated firm opposition to new limits on guns or ammunition, setting up the chance of a bitter legislative battle  soon after President Obama’s inauguration.
articles.abstract: Leading House Republicans restated firm opposition to new limits on guns or ammunition, setting up the chance of a bitter legislative battle  soon after President Obama’s inauguration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama declared on Wednesday that he would make gun control a “central issue” as he opens his second term, promising to submit broad new firearm proposals to Congress no later than January and to employ the full power of his office to overcome deep-seated political resistance.

articles.headline: Smile, and Say ‘Android’
articles.snippet: New cameras from Samsung and Nikon merge elements of the cellphone and the camera into something pioneering, but not yet at the promised land.
articles.abstract: New cameras from Samsung and Nikon merge elements of the cellphone and the camera into something pioneering, but not yet at the promised land.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Android camera.” Wow, that has a weird ring, doesn’t it? You just don’t think of a camera as having an operating system. It’s like saying “Windows toaster” or “Unix jump rope.”

articles.headline: N.Y.S.E. Is in Talks for Merger
articles.snippet: The IntercontinentalExchange is in talks to merge with the parent of the New York Stock Exchange, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday, potentially creating a major new player with footholds in the trading of stocks, derivatives and comm...
articles.abstract: The IntercontinentalExchange is in talks to merge with the parent of the New York Stock Exchange, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday, potentially creating a major new player with footholds in the trading of stocks, derivatives and commodities.
articles.lead_paragraph: An $8 billion exchange merger is in the works that underscores how the global market for derivatives has eclipsed that for stocks.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: In $18 Million Theft, Victim Was a Canadian Maple Syrup Cartel
articles.snippet: The police in Quebec arrested three men in connection with the theft of six million pounds of syrup from Canada’s global strategic maple syrup reserve.
articles.abstract: The police in Quebec arrested three men in connection with the theft of six million pounds of syrup from Canada’s global strategic maple syrup reserve.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — It was an inside job of sorts. Thieves with access to a warehouse and a careful plan loaded up trucks and, over time, made off with $18 million of a valuable commodity.

articles.headline: Municipalities Fight a Proposal to Tax Muni Bond Interest
articles.snippet: Municipalities claim they will have to pay more to finance construction projects if the president’s plan to tax some interest on municipal bonds is approved.
articles.abstract: Municipalities claim they will have to pay more to finance construction projects if the president’s plan to tax some interest on municipal bonds is approved.
articles.lead_paragraph: Timothy L. Firestine, the top government administrator in Montgomery County, Md., is crunching numbers in his battle to preserve the hallowed tax exemption on municipal bonds.

articles.headline: Lessons in Politics and Fine Print in Assault Weapons Ban of ’90s
articles.snippet: After a 1989 schoolyard shooting, it took five years of legislative slogging to pass a federal assault weapons ban. But the price of passage was a host of compromises.
articles.abstract: After a 1989 schoolyard shooting, it took five years of legislative slogging to pass a federal assault weapons ban. But the price of passage was a host of compromises.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than two decades before Newtown, there was Stockton.
articles.byline: By Michael Luo and Michael Cooper

articles.headline: Leniency Denied, UBS Unit Admits Guilt in Rate Case
articles.snippet: UBS scrambled until the last minute to avoid having its subsidiary plead guilty to fraud.
articles.abstract: UBS scrambled until the last minute to avoid having its subsidiary plead guilty to fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: UBS on Wednesday became the first big global bank in more than two decades to have a subsidiary plead guilty to fraud.

articles.headline: High-Speed Trade Giants to Merge
articles.snippet: Knight Capital agreed to be purchased by Getco in a $1.4 billion deal that could create a dominant force in several stock markets.
articles.abstract: Knight Capital agreed to be purchased by Getco in a $1.4 billion deal that could create a dominant force in several stock markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: The merger of two computer-driven trading firms is set to create a new company that market analysts say would most likely be the single largest player in the trading of American stocks, and a dominant force in several other markets.
